data.title: Wells Fargo Rewards: How To Earn And Redeem Them
data.meta_description: Here’s everything to know about Wells Fargo Rewards, including which cards earn them and what you can get.
data.text:
Wells Fargo Rewards is a new credit card rewards program offering flexible points when cardholders of select cards make qualifying purchases or other transactions. Depending on the card you have, every purchase may earn points at a flat rate or different types of purchases may earn at varying rates determined by the spending category.

New members may also earn bonus points when being approved for a new credit card in the program and meeting certain spending criteria.

How Much Are Wells Fargo Rewards Worth?

Wells Fargo keeps things simple by keeping most reward redemptions worth a flat 1 cent each. Here’s a quick look at common redemption options:

Redemption Value Per Point

Cash back or statement credits

$0.01

Travel booked through Wells Fargo

$0.01

Pay With Rewards at select merchants

$0.01

Gift cards

$0.01

In addition, Wells Fargo now allows members with eligible cards to transfer points to partnering travel loyalty programs. When doing so, the value of your points will be determined based on the airline or hotel program rather than through Wells Fargo Rewards. Redemptions could yield more or less than the 1 cent per point offered through the Wells Fargo travel portal depending on how you use them. Strategic use could make these worth 2 cents per point or more, offering outsized value.

Similarly, redemption values for points redeemed toward merchandise may vary and often yield less than 1 cent per point when you exchange your Wells Fargo Rewards for purchases like this. You’re likely better off shopping for a deal to purchase the item elsewhere and cashing out your rewards for a statement credit to reimburse yourself afterward.

Wells Fargo offers multiple cards that earn Wells Fargo Rewards. Each card offers different benefits and earning rates and you may be able to earn points through opening new credit cards to earn welcome bonuses, daily spending on qualifying charges and shopping through the Wells Fargo Rewards online portal.

Personal Wells Fargo Credit Cards

Card Annual Fee Welcome Offer Earning Rates Major Benefits

$0

Earn 20,000 bonus points after spending $1,000 in purchases in the first 3 months

Earn 3 points per dollar at restaurants, travel, gas stations, transit, popular streaming services and phone plans, 1 point per dollar on other purchases

0% introductory APR on purchases for 12 months from account opening. A variable APR of 20.24%, 25.24%, or 29.99% applies for purchases after the intro period ends and for balance transfers. The card has a balance transfer fee of up to 5%, minimum $5

$95

Earn 60,000 bonus points after spending $4,000 in the first 3 months of account opening

Earn 5 points per dollar on hotels, 4 points per dollar on airlines, 3 points per dollar on other travel and restaurants and 1 point per dollar on other purchases

Receive a $50 annual statement credit with a $50 minimum airline purchase.

$0

Earn a $200 cash rewards bonus after spending $500 in purchases in the first 3 months

Earn 2% cash rewards on purchases

0% intro APR for 12 months from account opening on purchases and qualifying balance transfers, then a 20.24%, 25.24%, or 29.99% variable APR applies. Balance transfers made within 120 days qualify for the intro rate and fee of 3% (min. $5) then a fee of up to 5% (min. $5) applies

Wells Fargo Business Credit Cards

Right now, there are no business credit cards available to new applicants that earn Wells Fargo Rewards.

Cards Not Accepting New Applications

Wells Fargo has several discontinued cards that may also earn rewards points if you already hold the card. Be aware that some redemption options may not be available to you; See your cardholder agreement for current rewards eligibility and details.

This information was collected independently by Forbes Advisor and may no longer be accurate as the product terms change.

Wells Fargo Propel World American Express: Earn 3 Wells Fargo Rewards points on dining out and ordering in, popular streaming devices, gas stations, rideshare, transit, travel including flights, hotels, homestays and car rentals. Earn 1 Wells Fargo Rewards on all other purchases.

Wells Fargo Visa Signature Credit Card: Earn 5 Wells Fargo Rewards points per dollar spent on up to $12,500 on grocery, gas and drugstore purchases for the first six months and 1 Wells Fargo rewards point per dollar thereafter.

Wells Fargo Rewards Card: Earn 5 Wells Fargo Rewards points per dollar spent up to the first $12,500 spent on gas, grocery, and drugstore spending for the first six months. All other purchases earn 1 Wells Fargo rewards point per dollar.

Wells Fargo Business Platinum Credit Card*: With this card, you can choose your rewards: Cash Back or Rewards Points. Cash Back option: Earn 1.5% cash back on every $1 spent; Reward Points option: Earn 1 point on every $1 spent and receive 1,000 bonus points when your company spend is $1,000 or more in any monthly billing period.

Wells Fargo Business Elite Signature Card*: Earn 1.5% cash back per dollar spent or earn 1 point per dollar spent and receive 5,000 bonus points when the company spend is $10,000 or more in any monthly billing period.

Wells Fargo Business Secured Credit Card*: Earn 1.5% cash back per dollar spent on qualifying purchases or earn 1 point per dollar and receive 1,000 bonus points when the company spend is $1,000 or more in any monthly billing period.

Wells Fargo Bank Rules

Like most banks, Wells Fargo has its own application restrictions that you may need to consider if you are hoping to open a new card.

Wells Fargo may not approve you for a new credit card if you have opened a Wells Fargo card within the last six months. That means Wells Fargo allows you to earn one welcome offer, no matter which card, in a six month period. If you get a card with a 0% intro APR offer, for example, you won’t be eligible to get a card that earns a welcome bonus—even if you close the card—for six months.

Pool Points Between Wells Fargo Cards

If you hold more than one Wells Fargo Rewards card, your points will be combined into a single balance automatically unless you have automatic redemptions turned on. If so, you can still request the accounts be pooled anyway. Cardholders may also optionally combine points with someone else who is a joint owner of the account. This gives you the opportunity to take advantage of each card’s bonus categories and earn the highest return on spending possible with your combination of cards, which may include cards that are no longer open to new applications.

Though the Bilt World Elite Mastercard® (rates & fees) is issued by Wells Fargo, it earns Bilt Rewards points rather than Wells Fargo Rewards, which means balances between these two programs cannot be combined.

For most redemptions, using your Wells Fargo Rewards is a straightforward process. You can redeem them in a number of ways, including travel, as a statement credit toward your card balance, a cash withdrawal from an ATM, credit toward an eligible Wells Fargo loan (like a mortgage or personal loan), transferring them to travel partners or to buy gift cards or merchandise.

Transfer Wells Fargo Rewards to Travel Partners

Transferring rewards points to partner airlines and hotels can be the most complex redemption option, but it may also lead to outsized value. It’s not unheard of for points applied to award flights or free hotel nights to be worth two, three or even five cents per point.

Wells Fargo Rewards partners include:

Aer Lingus AerClub

Air France-KLM Flying Blue

Avianca Lifemiles

British Airways Executive Club

Choice Privileges

Iberia Plus

Currently, all airline transfers can be made at a 1:1 ratio. Transfers to Choice Privileges are at a 1:2 ratio, meaning that 10,000 Wells Fargo Rewards would convert to 20,000 Choice Privileges Rewards.

Wells Fargo doesn’t have any control over award availability or pricing with its transfer partners, so it’s best to confirm your travel reservations are available at an acceptable price before transferring your rewards. Once you’ve requested the transfer, the transaction is irreversible.

Use the Wells Fargo Travel Portal

Wells Fargo Rewards can be used for various forms of travel including flights, hotels, cruises, car rentals or vacation packages. You can also use your rewards toward the cost of experiences, like a safari excursion, a tee time on the golf course or exploring ancient ruins.

Unlike transferring your points directly to an airline or hotel, using the travel portal keeps your points worth an easy-to-remember one cent each. That might be a lower value than a points transfer, but it allows you to book with any brand of your choosing without worrying about blackout dates or other common availability restrictions.

Redeem for Cash Back

Using your points for cash back takes on somewhat of a new meaning when it comes to Wells Fargo. In addition to using your points as a statement credit, you can also get cash back through an ATM. Redemptions are only available in $20 increments when you use a Wells Fargo ATM. There’s a minimum redemption of 2,000 points.

Redeem for Purchases

You can redeem Wells Fargo Rewards for purchases you’ve already made with your card. You must have at least 100 points available in your account (worth $1), and you must have enough points to cover the entire transaction. When you redeem points for purchases, a statement credit is issued to your account, but you still need to pay the minimum payment.

Redeem for Gift Cards

Wells Fargo has an extensive selection of gift cards that you can use your Wells Fargo Rewards to buy. Wells Fargo Rewards are worth 1 cent each when redeemed for gift cards.

The Wells Fargo Rewards site may run specials on gift cards where you can purchase them at a discount, allowing you to score a higher return on your points. Deals like this pop up more often around holidays.

You can also donate your Wells Fargo Rewards to charity by using them to purchase a CharityChoice gift card, a project of Special Kids Fund, or by redeeming them to support disaster relief via the American Red Cross.

Use Wells Fargo Rewards Through PayPal

Link your Wells Fargo card to PayPal Wallet and use your rewards for eligible purchases at checkout when you shop online. You don’t have to use all your rewards at once and can adjust the amount to use for the purchase.

Other Ways To Use Wells Fargo Rewards

Lastly, you can redeem your Wells Fargo Rewards for merchandise. There are several categories you can choose from, including:

Home decor

Bags and luggage

Cookware

Bed and bath

Small appliances

Some of these categories have thousands of options. Whether or not the redemption is a good one will depend on the price charged by competitors. If you find an item cheaper elsewhere, remember you can redeem your Wells Fargo Rewards to your account and use the balance to fund the purchase from the cheaper retailer.

How Long Does It Take To Redeem Wells Fargo Rewards?

Redemptions will show as deductions from your rewards balance immediately, but Wells Fargo says it may take five to seven business days for statement credits to appear on your account. Statement credits may reduce your balance, but you are still responsible for making payments if a payment is due.

Air France-KLM Flying Blue

Flying Blue is a program that requires some hunting to find a good deal, but when you know where to look, there are fantastic sweet spots. The loyalty scheme doesn’t publish an award chart, but you can find some great deals, particularly when flying to or from Europe. Flying Blue also offers discounts in the form of Promo Rewards: These are advertised specials on select routes, which may save you up to 25% compared to the standard price of an award ticket.

Avianca LifeMiles

A member of Star Alliance, Avianca LifeMiles provides access to a number of award redemptions on its own routes as well as partners like United, Lufthansa and Asiana, all without adding fuel surcharges to the cost of an award ticket. The mileage required for reward flights is competitive and it’s one of the few programs that provides discounts on premium tickets when one or more legs of your journey is only available in economy.

Choice Privileges

While Choice Privileges isn’t the most prestigious of all hotel programs, they have an expansive footprint across the United States and other countries, including properties in locations that may not be served by more upscale brands. Hotel redemptions begin at just 8,000 points for a free night, which is equivalent to only 4,000 Wells Fargo Rewards points thanks to a 1:2 transfer ratio.
